snippet: As President Obama promised, the White House unveiled a College Scorecard Web site on Wednesday, but experts said it had many holes that needed to be filled.
abstract: Steps that Pres Obama promised in his State of the Union address to control college costs and give consumers more financial information draws tepid responses from educational groups, who say measures seem positive but have many blanks to be filled in; White House unveils College Scorecard Web site.
lead_paragraph: As President Obama promised, the White House unveiled a College Scorecard Web site on Wednesday, but experts said it had many holes that needed to be filled.

headline.seo: Obama’s College Scorecard Needs Works, Experts Say
headline.main: Scorecard for Colleges Needs Work, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Scorecard For Colleges Needs Work, Experts Say
